result.execSummary:
The defendant Marquese L Haines was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.
Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with family court order. Visits with children are to be supervised but can be modified in family court. Enroll in the Fatherhood Program at the YMCA. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Participate in cognitive thinking program. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Firearm warning given.Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

**AMENDED 10/4/2018: Per DOC Agent and with Court's approval, defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim J.G..**
